meanings.sent1: The looby tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a looby trying to dance in front of everyone.
meanings.sent3: The looby bumped into the door and apologized sheepishly.
meanings.sent4: He was a looby in the art of socializing, always saying the wrong thing.
meanings.sent5: The looby's awkwardness was so noticeable, it made everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a looby and fall for that trick.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been acting like a looby, believing everything she was told.
meanings.sent3: The looby thought the moon was made of cheese and everyone laughed.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a looby when he realized he had been scammed.
meanings.sent5: Being a looby in this situation will only lead to trouble.

meanings.definition: To behave in a clumsy or foolish manner.
meanings.sent1: He tends to looby around when he's nervous.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to looby through the presentation, so she practiced a lot.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to looby their way through the obstacle course for fun.
meanings.sent4: Don't looby your chances by not preparing for the interview.
meanings.sent5: She loobied her way through the party, knocking over drinks and stepping on toes.
